conclusion: Determine moments when particle's speed is 5 m/s by analyzing displacement-time graph.
Graph shows position x of a particle as a function of time t; x-intercept indicates times when particle is at x = 0.
To find speed, take derivative of position function to get velocity function.
Slope of tangent line at any point on graph gives instantaneous speed.
At t = 0, slope is very steep and negative; around t = 2, slope is steeper but still negative; around t = 4, slope becomes less steep but remains negative.
Visually estimate there are two points where slope of tangent line is approximately 5 m/s.
Precise calculation requires equation of curve; rely on graphical interpretation.
Based on graphical analysis, there are exactly two moments when speed is 5 m/s.
